snippet: A former garbage dump in New Jersey is helping restore crew to the New York metropolitan area, providing ideal rowing conditions unaffected by tides and boat traffic.
abstract: Overpeck Creek, former garbage dump in New Jersey, has become a hotspot for rowing in the New York metropolitan area; rowers say the creek's conditions are ideal, since it is unaffected by tides and boat traffic.
lead_paragraph: A former garbage dump in New Jersey is helping restore crew to the New York metropolitan area, providing ideal rowing conditions unaffected by tides and boat traffic.

headline.seo: Former New Jersey Landfill Is Now a Rowing Paradise
headline.main: Once an Urban Landfill, Now a Rowing Paradise
headline.print_headline: Once an Urban Landfill, Now a Rowing Paradise
